3615.verse: أَفَلَمْ|Then, do not|106|112|9302$يَرَوْاْ|they see|78|91|5421$إِلَىٰ|towards|73|86|118$مَا|what|53|66|262$بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ|(is) before them|127|140|2273$وَمَا|and what|82|95|46$خَلْفَهُم|(is) behind them|128|134|2274$مِّنَ|of|50|60|156$ٱلسَّمَآءِ|the heaven|95|115|157$وَٱلْأَرْضِۚ|and the earth?|118|138|352$إِن|If|44|64|225$نَّشَأْ|We will|66|86|12870$نَخْسِفْ بِهِمُ|We (could) cause to swallow them|250|260|14202$ٱلْأَرْضَ|the earth|92|100|197$أَوْ|or|41|57|154$نُسْقِطْ|cause to fall|102|118|14203$عَلَيْهِمْ|upon them|90|106|22$كِسَفًا|fragments|86|102|10539$مِّنَ|from|50|66|156$ٱلسَّمَآءِۚ|the sky.|84|100|157$إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|78|58$فِى|in|48|63|89$ذَٲلِكَ|that|64|95|28$لَأَيَةً|surely, is a Sign|125|156|2203$لِّكُلِّ|for every|80|111|3746$عَبْدٍ|slave|56|87|14204$مُّنِيبٍ|who turns (to Allah).|158|173|14205$

3616.verse: ۞ وَلَقَدْ|And certainly,|112|119|640$ءَاتَيْنَا|We gave|78|91|509$دَاوُۥدَ|Dawood|78|91|4647$مِنَّا|from Us|70|83|1169$فَضْلاًۖ|Bounty.|75|88|1766$يَـٰجِبَالُ|`O mountains!|115|128|14206$أَوِّبِى|Repeat praises|117|124|14207$مَعَهُۥ|with him,|80|101|1875$وَٱلطَّيْرَۖ|and the birds.`|120|161|11876$وَأَلَنَّا|And We made pliable|157|198|14208$لَهُ|for him|65|106|1807$ٱلْحَدِيدَ|[the] iron,|88|109|14209$

3617.verse: أَنِ|That|51|62|4149$ٱعْمَلْ|make|73|94|14210$سَـٰبِغَـٰتٍ|full coats of mail|129|150|14211$وَقَدِّرْ|and measure precisely|167|188|14212$فِى|[of]|48|69|89$ٱلسَّرْدِۖ|the links (of armor),|152|162|14213$وَٱعْمَلُواْ|and work|99|110|12308$صَـٰلِحًاۖ|righteousness.|116|137|622$إِنِّى|Indeed, I Am|105|126|312$بِمَا|of what|71|92|43$تَعْمَلُونَ|you do|92|113|725$بَصِيرٌ|All-Seer.`|85|96|911$

3618.verse: وَلِسُلَيْمَـٰنَ|And to Sulaiman,|132|140|11882$ٱلرِّيحَ|the wind -|89|105|11883$غُدُوُّهَا|its morning course|141|157|14214$شَهْرٌ|(was) a month|117|133|14215$وَرَوَاحُهَا|and its afternoon course|183|191|14216$شَهْرٌۖ|(was) a month,|122|129|14215$وَأَسَلْنَا|and We caused to flow|173|187|14217$لَهُۥ|for him|65|79|977$عَيْنَ|a spring|72|86|14218$ٱلْقِطْرِۖ|(of) molten copper.|149|163|14219$وَمِنَ|And [of]|75|82|74$ٱلْجِنِّ|the jinn|70|77|6030$مَن|who|50|64|76$يَعْمَلُ|worked|70|84|9659$بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ|before him|101|115|920$بِإِذْنِ|by the permission|136|150|919$رَبِّهِۖۦ|(of) his Lord.|106|120|392$وَمَن|And whoever|106|113|1012$يَزِغْ|deviated|77|92|14220$مِنْهُمْ|among them|101|132|730$عَنْ|from|54|85|1105$أَمْرِنَا|Our Command,|116|147|3355$نُذِقْهُ|We will make him taste|172|203|12040$مِنْ|of|50|66|53$عَذَابِ|(the) punishment|134|346|1160$ٱلسَّعِيرِ|(of) the Blaze.|116|328|11967$

3619.verse: يَعْمَلُونَ|They worked|105|116|912$لَهُۥ|for him|65|87|977$مَا|what|53|75|262$يَشَآءُ|he willed|77|99|867$مِن|of|50|72|53$مَّحَـٰرِيبَ|elevated chambers|145|167|14221$وَتَمَـٰثِيلَ|and statues|99|110|14222$وَجِفَانٍ|and bowls|86|100|14223$كَٱلْجَوَابِ|like reservoirs|110|138|14224$وَقُدُورٍ|and cooking-pots|135|163|14225$رَّاسِيَـٰتٍۚ|fixed.|98|126|14226$ٱعْمَلُوٓاْ|`Work,|85|113|6063$ءَالَ|O family|73|87|4078$دَاوُۥدَ|(of) Dawood!|107|119|4647$شُكْرًاۚ|(in) gratitude.`|121|146|14227$وَقَلِيلٌ|But few|74|99|14228$مِّنْ|of|50|75|53$عِبَادِىَ|My slaves|85|110|11945$ٱلشَّكُورُ|(are) grateful.|114|126|14229$

3620.verse: فَلَمَّا|Then when|93|104|141$قَضَيْنَا|We decreed|99|122|13468$عَلَيْهِ|for him|65|88|395$ٱلْمَوْتَ|the death,|90|113|894$مَا|not|42|65|262$دَلَّهُمْ|indicated to them|137|160|14230$عَلَىٰ|[on]|63|74|52$مَوْتِهِۦٓ|his death|81|92|4627$إِلَّا|except|65|87|86$دَآبَّةُ|a creature|89|111|14231$ٱلْأَرْضِ|(of) the earth|112|134|100$تَأْكُلُ|eating|64|86|8984$مِنسَأَتَهُۖۥ|his staff.|100|122|14232$فَلَمَّا|But when|82|93|141$خَرَّ|he fell down,|105|118|12074$تَبَيَّنَتِ|became clear|108|133|14233$ٱلْجِنُّ|(to) the jinn|101|126|14234$أَن|that|48|73|655$لَّوْ|if|41|66|905$كَانُواْ|they had|79|104|94$يَعْلَمُونَ|known|92|105|115$ٱلْغَيْبَ|the unseen,|99|105|5611$مَا|not|42|55|262$لَبِثُواْ|they (would have) remained|206|219|10631$فِى|in|48|61|89$ٱلْعَذَابِ|the punishment|122|135|482$ٱلْمُهِينِ|humiliating.|94|100|14235$

3614.verse: Has he invented about Allah a lie or is there in him madness?" Rather, they who do not believe in the Hereafter will be in the punishment and [are in] extreme error.

3615.verse: Then, do they not look at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and earth? If We should will, We could cause the earth to swallow them or [could] let fall upon them fragments from the sky. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant turning back [to Allah].

3616.verse: And We certainly gave David from Us bounty. [We said], "O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well]." And We made pliable for him iron,

3617.verse: [Commanding him], "Make full coats of mail and calculate [precisely] the links, and work [all of you] righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Seeing."

3618.verse: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And among the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze.

3619.verse: They made for him what he willed of elevated chambers, statues, bowls like reservoirs, and stationary kettles. [We said], "Work, O family of David, in gratitude." And few of My servants are grateful.

3620.verse: And when We decreed for Solomon death, nothing indicated to the jinn his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.
